Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We are given an event log with three cases We need to identify activities that appear multiple times within the same case and rename them to reflect their context Looking at the log we see that Verify Documents Call Customer and Adjust Account appear multiple times in some cases Also Initiate Request and Approve Request appear once per case so they are not ambiguous However Submit Additional appears only once in C001 so not a problem

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Lets analyze each case Case C001 Initiate Request once Verify Documents twice first at 0920 then at 1030 The first Verify Documents is the initial verification which found missing documents Then after the customer submits additional documents there is a re verification So we can rename first as Verify Documents Initial second as Verify Documents Reverification

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case C002 Initiate Request once Verify Documents once Call Customer twice first at 0900 second at 0950 Adjust Account once Approve Request once The first call is to clarify account discrepancy the second is a follow up call to confirm adjustments So rename first as Call Customer Clarify Discrepancy second as Call Customer Confirm Adjustments

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case C003 Initiate Request once Verify Documents twice first at 1125 second at 1220 Call Customer once Adjust Account once Approve Request once First verification is physical verification of ID Second verification is after account adjustment so its a reverification Call Customer is because customer stepped out officer calls to have them return

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: So for C003 Verify Documents first Verify Documents Initial Physical second Verify Documents Postadjustment Verification But note that in C001 we already have reverification However the context might be slightly different C001 reverification is after additional docs submitted C003 reverification is after account adjustment But both are essentially a second verification We might want to name them consistently

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The task says The same activity names appear multiple times within a single case but carry different contextual meanings depending on when and how they occur So we are to rename activities that recur within a case Adjust Account does not recur within a case so we only need to rename activities that appear multiple times in the same case That includes Verify Documents in C001 and C003 and Call Customer in C002

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: we might also consider that Verify Documents appears in all cases but the first occurrence might have different contexts in C001 its initial check in C002 its identity verification in C003 its physical verification But since they are not repeated within C002 we dont need to rename the single occurrence However for consistency we could rename all activities to be more descriptive but the task specifically asks for renaming activities that recur within a case to reflect contextual differences So we focus on those

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For C001 First Verify Documents Verify Documents Initial Check Second Verify Documents Recheck After Additional Docs For C002 First Call Customer Call Customer Clarify Discrepancy Second Call Customer Confirm Adjustments For C003 First Verify Documents Verify Documents Initial Physical Verification Second Verify Documents Reverification After Adjustment

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Justification For C001 the two Verify Documents activities are distinguished by their sequence the first is an initial check that often leads to follow up actions while the second is a reverification after additional documents are submitted The new names reflect this order and purpose For C002 the two Call Customer activities have different purposes the first is to clarify a discrepancy and the second is to confirm adjustments For C003 the two Verify Documents activities differ in context the first is an initial physical verification at the branch and the second occurs after an account adjustment
